name: Action for Singapore Dogs
voInfo: Do you feel the passion and the fire to help these dogs ? Use your strengths and passion to really make a difference ! There are so many ways to help, find out more!
adInfo: Thinking of getting a dog? View the many reasons why you should adopt one of these wonderful dogs who will provide a lifetime of love and joy!
doInfo: It takes a massive amount to keep our rescue, medical and shelter operations going monthly and this will be a great way to be a part of helping these helpless dogs who have no one but us to help them
description: Action for Singapore Dogs (ASD) is a registered Charity and was established in December 2000 as a non-profit organization with the mission to improve the welfare of stray and abandoned dogs in Singapore with a strict no-kill policy. We aim to fulfill our mission through various activities and programs including rescuing, fostering and re-homing of stray and abandoned dogs, advocating sterilization to control the stray population, responsible pet ownership and highlighting the virtues of our local dogs, the Singapore Specials.

name: Mdm Wong's Shelter and Friends
doInfo:
Contributions: Any contribution or offers of the following items would be extremely appreciated: 
- blankets
- towels
- newspapers
- small cardboard boxes, shoe box or slightly bigger as the cats like to snuggle in them
- plastic bags that are used as poo bags
- animal bathing products
- flea and tick treatments, especially 'Frontline' Spray - must be new/sealed
- cat toys - especially scratching posts or catnip mats
- cat / dog treats (non-milk-biscuits type, e.g. Fish 4 Dogs Tiddler Treats)
- cat / dog food (wet, dry or kibbles)
- dog leashes (thick, long)
- unwanted pet carriers / leads / harnesses
adInfo: Check out the animals for adoption here
voInfo: The shelter is currently recruiting regular and committed weekend volunteers. Please visit this link for more details:
description:
Mdm Wong's Shelter and Friends is one of the top rated place listed as Community Organization in Singapore 
 1) IMPORTANT NOTE: DO NOT bring any abandoned or rescued animals to our shelter. We WILL NOT accept them as we are operating at MAXIMUM CAPACITY. Please seek other alternatives.
 If you are in a position where you no longer want your pet due to a change in circumstances do not assume it can be 'deposited' at the shelter. We encourage all owners to explore alternatives such as rehoming with family or friends or temporarily getting the pet boarded for a short while. Never ever just put the animal out on the street to fend for itself. 
 If you are left with NO other option but to seek rehoming then please contact us at our email address with all necessary details including your full contact details and we will put a posting out on your behalf. Animal lovers consider pet abandonment as serious an issue as animals that are physically abused as this is mental abuse for the pet who doesnt understand why they are being given up.
 2) Visiting: Please let us know in advance if you are planning on visiting the shelter so we can advise the volunteers. 
 We prefer visitors not just to turn up as it can affect the animals so please notify us in advance through email as without that we may not be able to allow you in the shelter.

name: Mercylight
doInfo:
Mercylight is an approved Institution of a Public Character (IPC).
Your donations qualify for 2.5 times tax deduction.
Thank you everyone who has been a part of this so far, and to those who will also support us on our journey forward!
adInfo: Adopting a pet is an extremely rewarding decision, and we‚Äôre here to help you pick out the perfect four-legged family member. When you adopt a dog, not only are you adding to your family, you‚Äôre saving a life. All of our pets are waiting to give you their unconditional love and introduce you to the joy of pet ownership.
voInfo: If you are keen to join Mercylight, please click the button below.
description:
We are a group of animal lovers who have a strong desire to care for the animals, by helping them to find the right homes.
We started in 2009 as a handful of volunteers who fed stray dogs every evening in the eastern side of Singapore. Mercylight was incorporated in January 2015 as a non-profit organization with the aim to promote compassion for animals through the provision of animal welfare services and prevention of cruelty to animals. In May 2020, we were conferred the charity status and is now known as Mercylight Animal Rescue And Sanctuary Limited.
We obtained the Institution of Public Character (IPC) status on 24 January 2022. Thiswas a great milestone for MARS. With strong financial controlsand processes in place, we achieved IPC Status in 18 months fromCharity Status.
To date we have over 100 committed people volunteering as kennel volunteers, stray feeders, packers, fosterers and sponsors.
Animal rescue work is obviously not an easy task. There are about 7,000 stray dogs out there suffering from hunger, thirst, harsh weather conditions and unkind treatment. We are part of the nationwide initiative launched in November 2018, known as the Trap-Neuter-Release-Manage (TNRM) programme with the aim of sterilising more than 70 per cent of the stray dog population over five years.
 According to AVA, approximately 15,000 to 20,000 cats and dogs are put down yearly in Singapore because the shelters are full and there is no place to house the impounded animals. Choose to adopt a dog and you save two lives.

name: Metta Cats & Dogs Sanctuary
doInfo: Read more on the story and legacy behind Metta Cats & Dogs Sanctuary here.
adInfo:
WANNA ADOPT A KITTY 
 Check out the adoption gallery.
voInfo: Metta‚Äôs volunteers support owner Terry in keeping the shelter up and running, and in looking after our animals. We have a few volunteering activities:
description:
OUR MISSION 
 To provide a safe haven for injured, abused or abandoned animals, where all animals including old and special needs animals can live out the remainder of their days in safety and care. 
 OUR STORY 
 Metta Cats and Dogs Sanctuary is a non-profit organisation founded by Mdm Lee Siew Ying. In Pali language, ‚Äúmetta‚Äù means loving kindness and also refers to the special bond shared between humans and animals. 
 Established in 1999, the sanctuary started with 50 cats and now houses more than 200 rescued cats and dogs. Many of the residents lived a harsh existence on the streets before Mdm Lee took them in. Rain or shine, Mdm Lee, her son Terry, and the occasional hired help take care of the residents every day. For the animals, Metta Cats and Dogs Sanctuary is the only home that they have ever known. Metta is also one of the rare no-kill shelters in Singapore.
 Since Mdm Lee‚Äôs demise in 2019, Terry has taken over and operated the sanctuary single-handedly, with the assistance of a team of volunteers. Metta has to raise about $24,000 every month to keep the sanctuary going. This amount excludes the high cost of medical care as and when the animals need treatment. Currently, the sanctuary relies fully on donations and fundraising events to survive.

name: Save Our Street Dogs
doInfo:
Sponsor a pup or donate to our pet shelter 
 If you don‚Äôt have the space or time it takes to care for an animal, there are still ways that you can help. As we are a not-for-profit organisation, we are constantly short of resources and our kennel is stretched to the limit. Choosing to donate to our pet shelter is one way you can help; you can donate money or items and we even have a wish list of things that we need to keep the shelter running on a continual basis. Another option is sponsorship, you can choose a dog to sponsor on a month-to-month basis (min 3 months), which helps to cover the expenses incurred, until they find their forever home.
adInfo:
Foster or adopt a gorgeous rescue dog 
 So many people get caught up in the latest pet trend of owning a bulldog or a pug or a poodle that they completely overlook the rewarding experience of adopting a shelter pet. Adopting a dog is a big responsibility and you need to carefully consider whether you have the energy, space, time and dedication it takes to foster a safe and happy home environment for a dog or puppy. If you feel that you can provide these things, then have a look at the profiles of all the rescue dogs we have available for adoption.
voInfo:
Volunteer at our animal shelter 
 If you don‚Äôt have the space or lifestyle that suits owning a pet, but have a few spare hours in your week and want to make a contribution, then volunteering might be the best route. We‚Äôre always in need of extra help and there are a lot of different ways you can contribute.
description: SOSD is committed to the welfare of Singapore‚Äôs many street dogs. We vehemently oppose the culling of stray animals and believe that there is a more humane way to manage this problem. Our dog shelter exists to rescue, rehabilitate and rehome strays to give them a second chance at life. If you‚Äôre an animal lover with a great passion for our canine friends, there are plenty of ways you can participate and help give these beautiful creatures a chance to find their forever home. Whether you want to adopt a dog, be a dog shelter volunteer, donate to our pet shelter, become a sponsor or even a foster parent while our dogs await their forever homes, there are plenty of ways to show you care.

name: Kitten Sanctuary Singapore
doInfo:
WE NEED YOUR SUPPAWT. 
 Kitten Sanctuary Singapore rescues, rehabilitates and finds good homes for strays that may otherwise suffer horrible deaths on the streets of Singapore. 
 Your support helps us to improve their lives and to give them a chance at a safe and loving home with a family to call their own.
adInfo: Thank MEW for your interest in adopting! Check out the adoption instructions here
voInfo:
Be a Volunteer. 
 We need volunteers to help us clean, care for our cats and kittens and to help out with your skills (photography, videography, graphics design etc.) at our Kitten Sanctuary / Cat Museum. 
 If you are 25 years and above and are able to commit to a regular schedule, 
 please fill in the form to join our community.
description:
We are a collaboration between cat lovers, volunteers & adopters.
 Kitten Sanctuary Singapore or (KiSS) will continue the efforts of rescue, rehabilitation, education & re-homing started back in 2005 while building a strong infrastructure for knowledge growth.
 We have since rescued and rehomed more than 400 cats and still counting! 
 Our ‚ÄúChange YOUR Life, Save a Life‚Äù initiative encourages people to Learn, Rescue, Foster, Adopt, Volunteer & Donate and experience the miracle of giving back! Saving a life is as simple as taking action today! 
 We will provide the necessary knowledge and support to ensure your success.

name: Cat Paradise Sg
doInfo: You can also help us by booking a visit here
adInfo: Cat Paradise fosters and promote the adoption of rescued cats in a Cageless environment.
voInfo: Support Cat Paradise Sg by volunteering with Project LUNI.
description:
We find homes for homeless cats. 
 Cat Paradise provide a cozy Cat Cafe-like environment for the rescued cats. 
 We are open for adoptions and recreational visits.

name: Hamster Society Singapore
doInfo:
Many of the hamsters we take in are in need of medical attention. A trip to the vet averages about $100 and this may even amount to $800 for surgery cases. 
 Not only do donations help with our foster' vet fees, your donations will also help us cover expenses such as food, bedding, transportation and rescue.
adInfo: At HSS, we rescue, foster and re-home hamsters. This includes hamsters in need of medical care, who are abandoned and neglected. View our adoption policies and gallery!
voInfo: Our volunteers are the soul of HSS. Coming from various professional backgrounds, they have dedicated their precious time and skills to form who we are today.
description:
Advocating humane hamster pet care through education and outreach. 
 We are a non-profit, volunteer-run organisation dedicated to the promotion of humane care of pet hamsters. We want to address the neglect, abuse and abandonment of one of the more neglected pet animals in Singapore.

name: Animal Lovers League
doInfo:
Animal Lovers League is a registered charity that runs the largest ‚ÄúNO KILL‚Äù shelter in Singapore.
Over 500 abandoned, traumatised, abused and rescued doggies and kitties call the shelter their home.
We need your help to keep ALL running.
Walk with us. Feel with us. Support us.
Please donate to the care of our doggies and kitties today.
On behalf of all our dogs and cats, we thank you for your support.
adInfo:
Check out our adoption process here. 
Get a chance to interact with our furry kids,one-on-one, to find your perfect match!
All adoption visits are by appointment after our procedural screening. No walk-ins are allowed. We seek your understanding and co-operation with this. Thank you.
voInfo:
At ALL, volunteering is no glamorous task. 
 We are always in need of volunteers who are able to commit regularly on a long term basis, especially on weekdays.
The work load includes;
Cleaning of shelter grounds 
Mixing of food 
Showering and walking the dogs
Fixing up the facilities
All volunteers must be 18 and above.
For the weekend programme, all first-timers are required to attend four orientation sessions, held over Saturdays and Sundays.
For the weekday programme, all first-timers are required to attend four orientation sessions which will be held on Tuesdays and Thursdays.
If you are keen to join us as a volunteer, kindly complete the application form linked below. Please do not email your volunteer applications to us.
description:
Their forlorn and despondent state became our inspiration to better their lives. Our rescued animals, over 500 cats and dogs, became our charges to stay. Animal Lovers League, currently a registered no-kill shelter, became official in 2002 to legitimately garner sufficient support in our quest to control the stray population by sterilisation and not annihilation.
As one of the largest and longest serving animal welfare group in Singapore, ALL constantly needs the support of the public to help keep the charity running and continue caring for the animals. Some of the ways members of the public can help include, giving monetary contributions and monthly pledges, donating food for the cats and dogs and taking care of the animals.
Everyday, we hear pleas to save or rescue a life. We however, persist in rehoming and sheltering all those who seek refuge with us though the journey is a challenging and onerous one. We advocate adoption over buying.
Please stay with Animal Lovers League, walk with us, feel with us and continue to support so that we can continue helping our shelter creatures as well as our over 500 stray dogs and cats. These are daunting numbers, but we continue to strive for the sake of our animals, giving each and every one of them a voice.

name: Causes for Animals Singapore
doInfo:
HOW YOUR DONATIONS CAN HELP
Your kind Donation will help support its stay at a Shelter, keep it happy and healthy until we find its Forever Home.
There are our most important daily needs for rescuing the helpless and homeless animals of Singapore.
Everyday, we need to find funds to cover these basic needs.  Any help is vital to help these animals survive and find their own home.
adInfo:
Adoption
These are some of the wonderful animals we have available for adoption. Sponsorship
If you would like to sponsor any of these animals while they are waiting to be adopted, please click on dog's image
voInfo:
Volunteering for CAS
Looking to make a difference? Come offer us a helping hand at CAS! 
We are entirely run by volunteers...so help is always much appreciated. Check out the details about volunteering here.
description:
Helping The Helpless.....Loving The Unloved
Causes for Animals Singapore is a one-stop non-profit for everything a local shelter or animal welfare organisation could need.

name: Chained Dog Awareness Singapore
adInfo: We are ready for a new home!
voInfo: Are you interested in making a difference for dogs in need? Fill up the form below.
description:
In 2015, Chained Dog Awareness Singapore was started. The non-profit organisation was founded to raise awareness of the plight of the many dogs chained across Singapore. We believe in upholding the Five Domains of Animal Welfare, a new model proposed by Professor David Mellor and Dr Cam Reid in 1994, as a means of systematically identifying and grading the severity of different forms of welfare compromise by reformulating the Five Freedoms as ‚ÄòFive Domains‚Äô of nutrition, environment, health, behaviour and mental state.
Chaining dogs is contrary to these Five Domains and is one of the most inhumane punishments that a social animal like a dog can endure. Dogs chained and caged for prolonged periods of time are denied the opportunity to engage in everyday activities that promote physical and emotional health. These dogs will eventually suffer from being isolated, consistently alone, intense boredom, frustration, depression and sadness. An otherwise friendly and docile dog, when kept continuously chained or intensively confined in any way, becomes neurotic, unhappy, anxious and often aggressive.
We believe that man's best friend should not be permanently chained by their owners. Every year we advocate for 30-40 chained dogs, some rescued with AVS or other animal rescue organizations, while others surrendered by their owners.

name: Hope Dog Rescue
adInfo:
Whoever said money can't buy happiness has never paid an adoption fee!
Thinking of getting a dog? Ever considered adopting and rescuing a dog from the streets? Our rescued dogs are waiting to be brought home by a loving family.
Please fill up online adoption form  if you wish to adopt.
voInfo:
We are recruiting animal rescuers.
Loving and caring for animals goes without saying; but what will make you stand out from the pack?
If you don‚Äôt mind getting dirty with dog vomit, blood or mud.
If you have a dog pee/poo on you and can laugh about it.
If you are willing to commit time to helping out and you don‚Äôt mind cancelling dinners with friends or skipping other social outings as rescue work is last minute and ad-hoc.
If you can kiss and hug a stray, without worrying about getting dirty or contracting ringworms.
If you can rescue an injured animal, feel sad about it but bounce back stronger and more willing to help.
If you can get down on your knees and do manual labour ‚Äì bathing dogs, walking / training them, cooking and feeding them, cleaning up after them and more.
If you can put your ego aside and work with different volunteers for the betterment of the dogs.
Then write in to us. We WANT you! Email to fiona@hopedogrescue.org

name: Mutts & Mittens
doInfo:
By sponsoring, you'll change the lives of many others in need
Your monthly gift will help fund our rescue dogs and cats, food, and veterinary care for them.
You will receive updates on the rescue animal(s) that you are sponsoring.
Your gift will mean everything to all of them.
adInfo:
Give our rescued animals a shot at being your loving family member
Make appointment with us to meet your potential furkid, spend time and find out all about them in several visits.
If you would like to adopt, arrange with our staff for home visit then a home trial for a month or longer depending on the progress.
If the adoption is successful, we will need you to sign our adoption papers and there will be an adoption fee of $250 per furkid to cover the cost of microchipping, vaccinations, sterilisation and administration.
voInfo:
We have about 100 rescued dogs and cats with no owners or sponsors under our roof. Our volunteers help us rehabilitate, play and love these precious lives until they find their own furever homes.
Our community is small, but strong. We engage with multiple special needs organisations, and hope to spread compassion and love for our furry friends to whoever we come in contact with. We always welcome an extra pair of helping hands so if you would like to make a difference, please get in touch! Follow us on our Facebook to be notified of our next recruitment drive.
We look forward to having you in our community! üòÄ
description: Mutts & Mittens is a boarding facility, but that‚Äôs not all. Our proceeds go towards our passion ‚Äì animal welfare work. Our rescued dogs and cats have so much love to share! Find out about our programmes below to meet and give them a furever home! üòÄ

name: OSCAS
doInfo: Help us make a difference to the rescued dogs at our shelter! On behalf of our furry residents, thank you so much for your generosity.
adInfo: We have many wonderful dogs that are looking for their forever homes. Please scroll through our gallery below to view their profile, and click the button beneath it to contact us for further information about our adoption process and be sent an application form to complete. Thank you for choosing to adopt!
voInfo:
Volunteer Opportunities
Our shelter is managed almost entirely by volunteers, from rehabilitating, bathing and walking the dogs, to updating our website and social media platforms. Volunteers form an integral part of the shelter and we welcome you to join our family!
Animal Welfare
All of our dogs are strays rescued from the streets or from being culled. Most of them had little or no human interaction before coming into our shelter, and can be pretty shy. We need volunteers to rehabilitate, walk and bathe them, as well as monitor their well-being and health condition. Caring for a hundred dogs also means making sure we have enough food and treats for the dogs, their living conditions are clean and safe, and required necessities are adequately stocked.
Education & Outreach
One of our goals is to raise awareness and understanding of the plight of stray dogs in Singapore. Help us produce materials that we can use in sharing with schools, as well as in coordinating special projects in collaboration with other organizations such as corporations, old age homes, children‚Äôs homes, etc.
description: ADOPT A DOG SAVE A LIFE

name: Purely Adoptions
doInfo:
Help us to Help Them!
We are an animal welfare group that is funded entirely on public donations. Our funds go into the rescuing, fostering and medical fees of the rescues. This includes medication, vaccination, sterilisation and food.
No amount is too small, help us to help these deserving animals.
We also accept donations in a form of items.
adInfo:
Purely Adoptions is an animal welfare group and all adoption fees collected are channelled back into helping more rescues. The funds are used for sterilisation, medical fees, rescue and fostering.
We are also blessed with sponsors to enable us to provide each adopter with a starter pack to start you off with products and services we love and trust.
voInfo:
Be our Volunteer
As a non-profit, we rely heavily on individuals to help do the things we do at Purely Adoptions. We are looking for volunteers from all walks of life.
We need your expertise to help Purely Adoptions organize activities and events; as well as rehome abandoned pets and stray animals.
description:
Help Us to Help More Animals
Purely Adoptions Facebook was created in 2009 with the objective of sharing people‚Äôs post about puppies, stray animals and home pets up for adoptions. Over time, more and more like-minded people came onboard and we grew into a community but our mission still remains the same as a decade ago which is to:
To raise awareness of the abandoned pets in Singapore, by providing a channel where family who wants to give up their pets. This same channel is also an avenue for family who wants to adopt one.
To reduce to number of stray and abandoned pets in Singapore by rehoming, fostering, adopting and whole process of integration of these animals.
Embark on this journey with us. Help save more animals

name: SPCA
doInfo:
Donation Details
Every year, SPCA Singapore needs at least $3 million to run all its services ‚Äî 24/7 emergency rescues, cruelty & welfare investigations, Singapore‚Äôs only non-profit community animal clinic, sterilisation and adoption programmes, an animal shelter, education outreach, and more.
Every dollar you donate will help us change lives. Thank you.
adInfo:
Adoption Gallery
Thank you for your interest in adopting an animal! All visits are now by appointment only and slots will only be released 7 days beforehand. Book an appointment at bit.ly/SPCABooking.

name: Voices for Animals
adInfo: Check out the available animals for adoption here
description:
About Us
Voices For Animals (VFA) is a registered non-profit society/charity founded in 2013 by a group of animal lovers dedicated to helping retired breeding dogs have a second chance in life by rehabilitating and rehoming them. Their rehoming efforts have also expanded to helping other small animals (cats, rabbits etc) from time to time.
Voices For Animals is run by volunteers and the fundings for shelter operations come mainly from monthly adoption drives and contributions from well-wishers. A huge amount of funds goes to the rescued animals' medical bills. To date, they have rehomed over 1,500 animals and are currently providing shelter for over 250 animals.
